le is a world authoris

Christmas,
Deco 25 th
We have been enjoying the songs of the Hawaiians
at Christmas
with those marvelous voloes and unequalied harmony.
One oft
repeated home-side Christmas song is apparently taboo out here
In the 50th state.
Perhaps 'it is frowned upon by the H.V.B. At any
rate they do not play or sing "White Christmas".
Perhaps they ame
afraid some of the d-
- Tankees will get nostalgio and go home.
Most of you have beazd of "custoners men", they are the number one
misnoner in all the world.
In a brokerage office the "customer's
man's" only funation da to "take" the customer in every conceivable
way for the benefit of the house.
Today Debby and I net a real honest
to goodness
"Customer's man".
We thought of going to alot of placed
for Christmas dimer bat finally concluded that wood rather atay home.
The
restaurant in this hotel was praotioally deserted. All the walters
and waitresses had the day off.
The Japanese boy who waited on us was
quite obviously a fugitive fron the dish washers chain gang, snatobed
off the job to fill in as a waiter. He ordered avacados stuffed with
chroken salad. - Our gaites aaid "those avocados are not so good- I
think you'd better have tomatoes" so we did.
Then for desert balty
ordered a piece of chocolate cake but our waiter said " I wouldn"t eat
that if I were you, ite been in the ice box for a long time". So at
last I've met a
real "customer's man". I gave him a vezy large tip
and a "Herry
Christmas" which I'm sure was as unusual for him as was the
oustoner-de
man's servioe for us.
At any rate we had a grand Christnas,
most of it spent on the calm, sun-drenched beach at Walkiki.
